summary: This is an email chain from April 2020, referencing internal FBI communications from July 2019 regarding the planning for Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and subsequent investigative approaches. It includes detailed guidance from SDNY prosecutors on how to approach key individuals, the criminal allegations against Epstein, and operational logistics for the arrest at Teterboro airport.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation, arrested and charged with sex trafficking of minor girls and conspiring with others to commit sex trafficking.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's former girlfriend, believed to have assisted in recruiting victims and traveled extensively with him. Listed as a subject to be approached with a subpoena.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Described as a former close friend and associate of Epstein who later had a falling out. Reported to have recruited minors for sexual activity with Epstein and ran a modeling agency.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.role: Long-time friend and associate of Epstein
persons.context: A billionaire founder of The Limited, described as having a decades-long business relationship with Epstein. Listed as an individual to be approached, likely just for a subpoena drop.

persons.name: William J. Gang II
persons.context: FBI agent communicating about surveillance at an address in Hendersonville related to the investigation.

persons.name: Jason A. Kaplan
persons.context: FBI agent copied on email communications regarding the arrest and investigative approaches.

persons.name: Eugene J. Vinson
persons.context: FBI agent copied on email communications regarding the arrest and investigative approaches.

connections.description: Described as his girlfriend for many years, believed to assist in recruiting victims and traveling extensively with him.
Described as a former close friend and associate, with reports of recruiting minors for sexual activity for Epstein. Later had a falling out and litigation.
Described as a long-time friend and associate with a decades-long business relationship.
Both are FBI agents copied on the same operational emails regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Epstein Arrest at Teterboro
events.description: Notification that Epstein's flight manifest showed he would be landing at Teterboro airport, prompting plans for law enforcement to meet and execute an arrest.

events.title: Surveillance at Hendersonville Address
events.description: FBI surveillance conducted at an address in Hendersonville believed to belong to parents of an individual associated with Epstein, observing vehicles registered to them.

events.title: Investigation Briefing Distributed
events.description: SDNY prosecutors distributed detailed background and guidance for approaching subjects and witnesses following Epstein's arrest, including criminal conduct overview and approach protocols.

keyFacts: The document outlines the plan for Jeffrey Epstein's arrest upon his return to the U.S., with his flight scheduled to land at Teterboro airport on July 6, 2019.

SDNY prosecutors provided detailed guidance on approaching key individuals like Ghislaine Maxwell, Jean Luc Brunel, and Leslie Wexner, noting they are subjects who may have direct knowledge of or participated in the crimes.
The criminal conduct overview states Epstein enticed dozens to hundreds of underage girls for sexual activity in exchange for money, using a massage pretext at his homes in New York and Florida.
The document notes Epstein's prior non-prosecution agreement in Florida does not apply to SDNY charges, and the new charges involve conduct beyond the scope of that agreement.
Special approach protocols were required for certain individuals potentially represented by counsel, requiring agents to first ask about legal representation before proceeding.
